item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "People who claim that they're evil are usually no worse than the rest of us... It's people who claim that they're good, or any way better than the rest of us, that you have to be wary of." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Get busy living or get busy dying." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The road to hell is paved with adverbs." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "A short story is a different thing all together - a short story is like a kiss in the dark from a stranger." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Good books don't give up all their secrets at once." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The man in black fled across the desert, and the gunslinger followed." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Fiction is the truth inside the lie." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description:
"I do not aim with my hand; he who aims with his hand has forgotten the face of his father. I aim with my eye.
I do not shoot with my hand; he who shoots with his hand has forgotten the face of his father. I shoot with my mind.
I do not kill with my gun; he who kills with his gun has forgotten the face of his father. I kill with my heart." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Fault always lies in the same place: with him weak enough to lay blame." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "It is the tale, not he who tells it." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Without story books is like a person with no soul." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "All is forgotten in the stone halls of the dead. These are the rooms of ruin where the spiders spin and the great circuits fall quiet, one by one..." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Sometimes there is absolutely no difference at all between salvation and damnation." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "But still, sometimes, in the heart of winter when the light outside seemed yellow- sleepy, like a cat curled up on a sofa..." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you want to be a writer, you must do two things above all others: read a lot and write a lot." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "I worry about you Bev. I worry a lot." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Time slowed and reality bent; on and on the eggman went." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Substitute 'damn' every time you're inclined to write 'very;' your editor will delete it and the writing will be just as it should be." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; Truth isn't." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Go to heaven for the climate and hell for the company." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jenelle add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other." -- Mark Twain
